com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.swinginadapters

Class ViewAnimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.swinginadapters.ViewAnimator

  • public class ViewAnimator
extends Object
    A class which decides whether given Views should be animated based on their position: each View should only be animated once. It also calculates proper animation delays for the views.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ViewAnimator(ListViewWrapper listViewWrapper)
      Creates a new ViewAnimator, using the given ListViewWrapper.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ViewAnimator

        public ViewAnimator(ListViewWrapper listViewWrapper)
        Creates a new ViewAnimator, using the given ListViewWrapper.
        Parameters:
        listViewWrapper - the ListViewWrapper which wraps the implementation of the ListView used.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Call this method to reset animation status on all views.

      • setShouldAnimateFromPosition

        public void setShouldAnimateFromPosition(int position)
        Set the starting position for which items should animate. Given position will animate as well. Will also call enableAnimations().
        Parameters:
        position - the position.

      • setShouldAnimateNotVisible

        public void setShouldAnimateNotVisible()
        Set the starting position for which items should animate as the first position which isn't currently visible on screen. This call is also valid when the Views haven't been drawn yet. Will also call enableAnimations().

      • setLastAnimatedPosition

        void setLastAnimatedPosition(int lastAnimatedPosition)
        Sets the value of the last animated position. Views with positions smaller than or equal to given value will not be animated.

      • setInitialDelayMillis

        public void setInitialDelayMillis(int delayMillis)
        Sets the delay in milliseconds before the first animation should start. Defaults to .
        Parameters:
        delayMillis - the time in milliseconds.

      • setAnimationDelayMillis

        public void setAnimationDelayMillis(int delayMillis)
        Sets the delay in milliseconds before an animation of a view should start. Defaults to .
        Parameters:
        delayMillis - the time in milliseconds.

      • setAnimationDurationMillis

        public void setAnimationDurationMillis(int durationMillis)
        Sets the duration of the animation in milliseconds. Defaults to .
        Parameters:
        durationMillis - the time in milliseconds.

      • enableAnimations

        public void enableAnimations()
        Enables animating the Views. This is the default.

      • disableAnimations

        public void disableAnimations()
        Disables animating the Views. Enable them again using enableAnimations().

      • cancelExistingAnimation

        void cancelExistingAnimation(android.view.View view)
        Cancels any existing animations for given View.

      • animateViewIfNecessary

        public void animateViewIfNecessary(int position,
                          android.view.View view,
                          com.nineoldandroids.animation.Animator[] animators)
        Animates given View if necessary.
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the item the View represents.
        view - the View that should be animated.

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public android.os.Parcelable onSaveInstanceState()
        Returns a Parcelable object containing the AnimationAdapter's current dynamic state.

      • onRestoreInstanceState

        public void onRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Parcelable parcelable)
        Restores this AnimationAdapter's state.
        Parameters:
        parcelable - the Parcelable object previously returned by onSaveInstanceState().
